hints.content: Let's try each strategy one at a time to see if they work.

Add $62+1$ then add $20$.

> $\begin{align}\\
\greenD{62}+\purpleC{21}=&\greenD{62}+(\purpleC{1}+\purpleC{20}) \\
=&(\greenD{62}+\purpleC{1})+\purpleC{20}  \\
\end{align}$

>Yes, this strategy works.

Add $60+20$ then add $21$.

>$\begin{align}\greenD{62}+\purpleC{21}&=\greenD{60}+\greenD{2}+\purpleC{20}+\purpleC1\\
&= \greenD{60}+\purpleC{20}+\greenD{2}+\purpleC{1}\\
&= \greenD{60}+\purpleC{20}+3\\
&\ne \greenD{60}+\purpleC{20}+\redD{21}\\
\end{align}$

>No, this strategy does **not** work.

**The following strategy can be used to add $62+21$.**

- Add $62+1$ then add $20$.
